name: A CELLARDOOR Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters from "CELLARDOOR", find a 4-letter word for a toy that many girls might play with.
questions.explanation:
Doll.

	A doll, such a Barbie or a Beanie Bopper, is a toy that looks like a little person.  They also make baby dolls that talk, drink water, and cry!

questions.text: Using only letters from "CELLARDOOR", find a 4-letter word meaning a street.
questions.explanation:
Road.

	A road is a street used for public transportation.  Roads can be made of dirt, pebbles, stone, concrete, or all sorts of other stuff.

questions.text: Find a 4-letter word that means to use the telephone, or to shout for someone, using only letters in "CELLARDOOR".
questions.explanation:
Call.

	To call is to use a telephone to talk to your friends, or to shout for people, such as when your mom calls you in for supper.  It can also mean to visit, like a doctor might make a call on a sick patient.

questions.text: Using only letters from "CELLARDOOR", find a 3-letter word for a vehicle you might find on the street.
questions.explanation:
Car.

	A car is a vehicle with four wheels that people drive on the street, or ROAD!  A car can also be called an automobile, and comes in many shapes and sizes and types, like a bus, a van, or a truck.

questions.text: Find a 3-letter word meaning the opposite of new, using only letters found in "CELLARDOOR".
questions.explanation:
old.

	If something is old, it has been used for a long time, like an old toothbrush.  It can also mean a senior citizen, like an "old man", but that can sometimes be a mean thing to say to them.

questions.text: Using only letters from "CELLARDOOR", find a 4-letter word for something you might open and close as you walk into a room.
questions.explanation:
Door.

	A door is usually a swinging wooden square that fits in its "frame", and closes so the room has privacy.  Some doors lock, so nobody can come in without knocking.  Remember, it's always polite to knock on a door before going in a room.

questions.text: Find a 4-letter word meaning something that might come in a deck, using only letters in "CELLARDOOR".
questions.explanation:
card.

	A card is a small piece of cardboard that comes in a deck, usually of 52.  You might use them to play Go Fish or Old Maid.  A card can also be a note you send to someone for their birthday or another special occasion.

questions.text: Using only letters in "CELLARDOOR", find a 4-letter word for a running competition.
questions.explanation:
Race.

	A race is a running competition, but it can also be any competition involving speed.  To race can also mean to hurry along, like "he raced to the bathroom".

questions.text: Find a 4-letter word, using only letters from "CELLARDOOR", that means the center of an apple.
questions.explanation:
Core.

	The center of an apple, or anything, for that matter, is called a core.  To remove the center of an apple is to "core" it, and sometimes people say you "decore" it.

questions.text: Using only letters from "CELLARDOOR", find a 3-letter word for the part of your body that allows you to hear.
questions.explanation:
Ear.

	Most people have two ears, which allows them to hear sound.  Some people cannot hear sound at all through their ears, though.  An ear can also be a cob of corn.
